title: One-To-One Property of Exponential Functions
text: For any algebraic expressions s and $$t$$, and any positive real number $$b$$ that is not equal to $$1$$, $$b^s=b^t$$ if and only if $$s=t$$.
speech: For any algebraic expressions s and  t , and any positive real number  b  that is not equal to  1 ,  b to the s-th is equal to, b to the t-th  if and only if  s, is equal to t .
pacedSpeech: For any algebraic expressions s and   t
, and any positive real number   b
,   b to the s-th is equal to, b to the t-th
if and only if   s, is equal to t

title: Appylying the One-To-Property to the Problem
text: Both expressions have a base of $$2$$, so using the property, we see that $$x-1=2x-4$$.
speech: Both expressions have a base of  2 , so using the property, we see that  x, minus 1, is equal to, 2 x minus 4 .
pacedSpeech: Both expressions have a base of   2
, so using the property, we see that   x, minus 1, is equal to, 2 x minus 4
